Ingest_LDD.name: MER Mission Dictionary
Ingest_LDD.comment:
The MER mission dictionary contains classes and attributes specific to the MER mission and instruments. This dictionary was created for the migration of MER data products from PDS3 to PDS4.
Built with LDDTool -plMJ ldd-mer.xml

DD_Attribute.name: download_priority
DD_Attribute.definition: The download_priority attribute specifies which data to downlink/transmit, based on order of importance. The lower numerical priority (higher-ranked number) data products are transmitted before higher numerical priority (lower-ranked number) data products. For example, an image with a downlink priority of 24 will be transmitted before an image with a downlink priority of 62. The allowable range is 0 to 99.

DD_Attribute.name: local_true_solar_time_sol
DD_Attribute.definition: The local_true_solar_time_sol element specifies the number of solar days elapsed since a reference day (e.g. the day on which a landing vehicle set down) for local true solar time (LTST). Days are measured in rotations of the planet in question from midnight to midnight. The reference day is '1', as landing day is Sol 1.

DD_Attribute.name: magnet_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The magnet_id specifies a magnet that is visible in an image or measured by an instrument.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Target is the capture magnet located at the base of the PMA.
Target is the filter magnet located at the base of the PMA.
Target is the sweep magnet located at the rear of the rover deck next to the Pancam calibration target.
Target is one or more of the magnets mounted on the outer ring of the RAT.

DD_Attribute.name: mission_phase_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The mission_phase_name identifies a time period within the mission.

DD_Attribute.name: producer_institution_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The producer_institution_name specifies the identity of the facility or institution that produced the product.

DD_Attribute.name: product_type
DD_Attribute.definition: The product_type identifies a group of data products within a collection that have some property in common, such as processing level, resolution, or instrument-specific setting.

DD_Attribute.name: product_version_id
DD_Attribute.definition: The product_version_id specifies the version of the product. It usually begins with a 'V' and followed by an identifier for the controlling camera SIS.

DD_Attribute.name: release_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Release_id is the identifier of a scheduled release of MER data from PDS. The first MER data release is Release 0001. The release_id for a given product is always the first release in which it appears, and does not change if the product is revised later.

DD_Attribute.name: sol_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Sol_number is the number of the Mars day on which an observation was acquired. Landing day is Sol 1.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_count_partition
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_count_partition provides the clock partition active for the spacecraft_clock_start_count and spacecraft_clock_stop_count attributes. This attribute may be used when the spacecraft_clock values do not include a partition number.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_start_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_start_count is the value of the spacecraft clock at the beginning of an observation. It represents the number of ticks. If a fractional value is present, in some cases it means a true decimal fraction (i.e. milliseconds) while in other cases it stands for a count of 1/256th of a second (which stems from the fact that the fractional part was represented by a single byte in the original telemetry stream.) When comparing SCLK times or converting them to other time systems, it is important to know which of the two representations the SCLK string follows. Normally the documentation accompanying a particular data set defines which type of SCLK fractional part was used in that data set.

DD_Value_Domain.formation_rule: [p/]ddddddddd[.fff] - In MER science product labels and accompanying documentation, and in supporting data products, the on-board clock (SCLK) times are represented by a string in the "SSSSSSSSS.FFF" format. In this string "SSSSSSSSS" represents integer SCLK seconds while "FFF" represents fractional SCLK seconds.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_clock_stop_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_clock_stop_count is the value of the spacecraft clock at the end of an observation. It represents the number of ticks. If a fractional value is present, in some cases it means a true decimal fraction (i.e. milliseconds) while in other cases it stands for a count of 1/256th of a second (which stems from the fact that the fractional part was represented by a single byte in the original telemetry stream.) When comparing SCLK times or converting them to other time systems, it is important to know which of the two representations the SCLK string follows. Normally the documentation accompanying a particular data set defines which type of SCLK fractional part was used in that data set.

DD_Value_Domain.formation_rule: [p/]ddddddddd[.fff] - In MER science product labels and accompanying documentation, and in supporting data products, the on-board clock (SCLK) times are represented by a string in the "SSSSSSSSS.FFF" format. In this string "SSSSSSSSS" represents integer SCLK seconds while "FFF" represents fractional SCLK seconds. Unfortunately the meaning of "FFF" varies across different data sets.

DD_Attribute.name: angular_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The amount of radians to move around the RAT revolve axis before a scan completes or amount of radians to move before moving the RAT z-axis down one step.

DD_Attribute.name: angular_distance_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The name of the operation with the RAT revolve motor movement.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The operation was a RAT grind.
The operation was a RAT dwell.

DD_Attribute.name: angular_velocity
DD_Attribute.definition: The angular velocity used in the operation of the RAT revolve axis.

DD_Attribute.name: clearance_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The RAT z-axix backoff distance for a dwell operation after a grind to clear the RAT hole of dust.

DD_Attribute.name: command_opcode
DD_Attribute.definition: This value is a code that defines the command operation.

DD_Attribute.name: error_condition
DD_Attribute.definition: RAT error condition, mostly likely related to the butterfly contact switchs.

DD_Attribute.name: error_state
DD_Attribute.definition: Flags to indicate various RAT error states. See the RAT SIS for more details.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_angular_velocity
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum RAT revolve motor velocity for a scan and grind operation.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_current_persistence
DD_Attribute.definition: Number of RTIs at maximum current.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_travel_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum allowable travel distance relative to the RAT z-axis hard stop.

DD_Attribute.name: rotation_noload_current
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifics the RAT noload current value. Units are mA, but not given in the label.

DD_Attribute.name: rotation_torque_parameter
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifics a torque value for the RAT grinding wheel rotation during a scan or grind operation. Given in units of mN*meter, but units are not listed in the label.

DD_Attribute.name: rotation_voltage
DD_Attribute.definition: Value of the voltage applied to the RAT grinding wheel rotation motor.

DD_Attribute.name: rotation_voltage_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The name of the RAT operation that the rotation voltage applies.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The operation was a RAT seek.
The operation was a RAT scan.

DD_Attribute.name: sampling_parameter_interval
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifics the number of RTIs that are skipped between telemetry samples in detailed RAT reports.

DD_Attribute.name: timeout_parameter
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifics the time limit for the RAT revolve moter to make a complete revolution during a grind operation.

DD_Attribute.name: torque_constant
DD_Attribute.definition: Ratio of RAT rotate motor torque to current. Units are mN*meter/mA, but unit is not listed in label.

DD_Attribute.name: torque_gain
DD_Attribute.definition: RAT torque controller gain value. See RAT SIS, appendix B for units.

DD_Attribute.name: torque_gain_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The name for the type of RAT torque gain.

DD_Attribute.name: z_axis_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: This is the offset for the RAT z-axis position at the start of a diagnostic, calibration, grind, or brush command.

DD_Attribute.name: z_axis_position
DD_Attribute.definition: This is the RAT z-axis offset relative to the lower hard stop that the RAT will move to at the start of a brush command.

DD_Attribute.name: z_axis_step_size
DD_Attribute.definition: The is the distance that the z-axis will step after a complete revolution.

DD_Attribute.name: z_axis_velocity
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifics the z-axis velocity during a movement. Units are in mm/s, but are not listed in the label.

DD_Attribute.name: z_axis_velocity_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The name of the RAT operation that the z-axis velocity applies.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The operation was a RAT seek.
The operation was a RAT scan.

DD_Attribute.name: linear_motor_status_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: Provides the status of the Michelson motor.

DD_Attribute.name: field_of_view
DD_Attribute.definition: The instantaneous field of view of the instrument that was used while acquiring the data.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The field of view was 8 mrad.
The field of view was 20 mrad.

DD_Attribute.name: gain_state
DD_Attribute.definition: Specifies the gain state of the MiniTES analog signal amplifier.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The gain state parameter was set to low.
The gain state parameter was set to high.

DD_Attribute.name: optical_switch_state
DD_Attribute.definition: Indicates which of the optical switches was used by the miniTES optical mirror. There are two switches for redundancy in case one fails.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The primary optical switch was used while acquired the data.
The redundant optical switch was used while acquired the data.

DD_Attribute.name: laser_1_status_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: Status of the primary laser. Only onen laser can be on at one time.

DD_Attribute.name: laser_2_status_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: Status of the backup laser. Only onen laser can be on at one time.

DD_Attribute.name: laser_heater_status_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: The status of the laser heater.

DD_Attribute.name: spare_bit_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: The status of the spare bit within the command word.

DD_Attribute.name: coordinate_id
DD_Attribute.definition: Identifies the frame in which the coordinate values are given.

DD_Attribute.name: coordinate_name
DD_Attribute.definition: Name associated with each coordinate in the Coordinate_Parameters class.

DD_Attribute.name: coordinate_value
DD_Attribute.definition: The value of the coordinate named by coordinate_name in the Coordinate_Parameters class.

DD_Attribute.name: coordinate_unit
DD_Attribute.definition: The unit for the coordinate value by coordinate_name in the Coordinate_Parameters class.

DD_Attribute.name: center_azimuth
DD_Attribute.definition: The commanded center azimuth of the acquired data.

DD_Attribute.name: center_elevation
DD_Attribute.definition: The commanded center elevation of the acquired data.

DD_Attribute.name: columns
DD_Attribute.definition: Commanded value of the number of columns (azimuth steps) to acquire.

DD_Attribute.name: rows
DD_Attribute.definition: Commanded value of the number of rows (elevation steps) to acquire.

DD_Attribute.name: dwell
DD_Attribute.definition: Commanded value of the number of icks to acquire at one azimuth/elevation position.

DD_Attribute.name: vertical_space
DD_Attribute.definition: Commanded value of the vertical spacing between consecutive rows.

DD_Attribute.name: horizontal_space
DD_Attribute.definition: Commanded value of the horizontal spacing between consecutive columns.

DD_Attribute.name: co_add
DD_Attribute.definition: Commanded number of spectra to average together.

DD_Attribute.name: cal_frequency
DD_Attribute.definition: Commanded value of the minimum number of icks between internal calibration looks.

DD_Attribute.name: cal_dwell
DD_Attribute.definition: Commanded value of the number of icks to acquire during a calibration observation.

DD_Attribute.name: cal_co_add
DD_Attribute.definition: Commanded number of calibration observations to average together.

DD_Attribute.name: phase_algorithm_name
DD_Attribute.definition: Commanded value of the phase correction algorithm to use on board.

DD_Attribute.name: low_channel
DD_Attribute.definition: Commanded value of the start channel number to acquire. Channel numbers start at zero.

DD_Attribute.name: high_channel
DD_Attribute.definition: Commanded value of the end channel number to acquire minus one.

DD_Attribute.name: zone2_width
DD_Attribute.definition: Commanded length of the center-burst region of the interferogram, which is compressed separately from zone1 and zone-3.

DD_Class.name: MER_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: Container class for general MER related parameters.

DD_Class.name: Rotation_Voltage_Index
DD_Class.definition: Subclass for values of rotation motor voltages.

DD_Class.name: Torque_Gain_Index
DD_Class.definition: Subclass for values of torque gain.

DD_Class.name: Z_Axis_Velocity_Index
DD_Class.definition: Subclass for values of z-axis velocity.

DD_Class.name: RAT_Seek_Scan_Request_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: Class of RAT seek scan parameters.

DD_Class.name: Angular_Distance_Index
DD_Class.definition: Subclass for values of angular distance.

DD_Class.name: RAT_Grind_Request_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: Class of RAT grind request parameters.

DD_Class.name: RAT_Brush_Request_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: Class for RAT brush request parameters

DD_Class.name: MiniTES_Coordinate_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: Specifies one of several coordinate parameters for a miniTES observation.

DD_Class.name: MiniTES_Command_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: Specifies the set of commands used to acquire a miniTES observation.

DD_Class.name: MiniTES_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: Main class to hold parameters related to a miniTES observation.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ( (mer:spacecraft_clock_count_partition) or ( (contains(mer:spacecraft_clock_start_count, '/')) and (contains(mer:spacecraft_clock_stop_count, '/')) ) or ( (not (mer:spacecraft_clock_count_partition)) and (not (mer:spacecraft_clock_start_count)) and (not (mer:spacecraft_clock_stop_count)) ) ) then true() else false()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: mer:error:sclk_rule_0: If spacecraft_clock_start_count and spacecraft_clock_stop_count are present, they must begin with a partition number followed by a forward slash, OR the partition number must be given by spacecraft_clock_count_partition.
